p: In light of the BTV and SBV endemic experiences in northern Europe, it appears that the Culicoides species that are indigenous in northern temperate regions have the potential to transmit ruminant arboviruses ( 273, 274). It is necessary to assess the vector capacity of Culicoides species which are distributed in the higher-latitude regions in East Asia. It is also important to determine their distribution range and seasonality to gain a greater understanding of the potential risks of arbovirus spreads, even in previous arbovirus-free regions.
